TopicTitle: SAS with RCS goes bonkers switching between ships

Articles.Content:
I can supply a video, but essentially when leaving a craft in orbit with SAS on and set to orient craft towards "normal", then switching to another craft will cause the physics of the first craft to go a bit nutty.  Most of the time the craft will hit a very high RPM without changing orbit much. Switching back to control the original craft typically "wakes up SAS" and it begins correcting to point towards normal again. Some of the time, though, the crafts just seem to fire all RCS thrusters in one direction and switching back to the craft means having to re-stabilize the orbit and try again. 

Also, SAS needs better PID algorithms. Instead of aligning with target (when overpowered) with short controlled bursts, it uses what seems to be a default burst and if there are too many rcs thrusters on a craft for its mass, they just seem to burn up MP without making any progress.
